title: How to Do a Celtic Knot Braid

steps.title: Grab a thin section of hair from each side of your head.
steps.content: Grab a thin section of hair from each side of your head. Pull the sections from your temples or just above your ears. You will be using these to form the knot, so make them thinâ€”about the thickness of a pen or pencil. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the left strand into a loop.
steps.content: Fold the left strand into a loop. Position the loop at the center-back of your head. Point the loop upward and hold it between the thumb and forefinger on your left hand. Make the loop about two fingers thick.

steps.title: Hold the right strand between your left pinky and ring fingers.
steps.content: Hold the right strand between your left pinky and ring fingers. Take the right strand with your right hand. Wrap it around the back of your head, towards your left hand. Grab it with your left pink and ring finger. Left go of the strand with your right hand.

steps.title: Pull the right strand upwards behind the left strand.
steps.content: Pull the right strand upwards behind the left strand. Slide your right thumb and forefinger down through the top of the left strand, so that they are between the strand and your head. Grab the right strand, and pull it upwards so that it's between the left strand and your head. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Clip the loop in place.
steps.content: Clip the loop in place. Unless you have a helper, you will need to clip the loop in place. Use a duck bill hair clip to secure the left loop. Leave the right strand along for now.

steps.title: Bring the right strand over the top of the loop.
steps.content: Bring the right strand over the top of the loop. Grab hold of the right loop. Pull it away from your head, then drag it downward so that it crosses in front of the left loop. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Push the end of the right strand through the loop, towards your head.
steps.content: Push the end of the right strand through the loop, towards your head. Slid your fingers under the right strand and out through the left loop. Grab hold of the right strand, and pull it through the loop, towards your head. Continue pulling the strand under the right strand. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Let go of the knot.
steps.content: Let go of the knot. Gently tighten it. Find the tail ends of both strands. Gently tug on them to tighten the knot.

steps.title: Finish the knot.
steps.content: Finish the knot. Gently tug on the loops to even them out. Once you are happy with their placement, clamp the knot between a flat iron. This will help set the knot and smooth it out. Finish off with a light misting of hairspray. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Take four thin strands of hair.
steps.content: Take four thin strands of hair. Grab a thick section of hair from your hair line. Divide that section into four smaller strands. For the sake of this tutorial, think of them as strands: A, B, C, and D.

steps.title: Weave the first strand through the other strands.
steps.content: Weave the first strand through the other strands. Take strand A. Cross it over strand B, then under strand C. Finally, bring it over strand D. You are working from right to left. [6] X Research source For the rest of this tutorial, you will be weaving the middle two strands, and ignoring the other two strands.

steps.title: Weave strand D back through the other strands.
steps.content: Weave strand D back through the other strands. Now, you are working from left to right. Ignoring strand A, weave strand D over strand C and under strand B. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Weave strand B through the other strands.
steps.content: Weave strand B through the other strands. Ignore strand D. Take strand B. Weave it under strand C and over strand A on the far left side. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Continue weaving the strands back and forth.
steps.content: Continue weaving the strands back and forth. Always ignore the first and last strands on the far left and right. Weave them over and under across the other strands, like a basket, until you reach the bottom. [9] X Research source Keep braiding until the braid is the length you want.

steps.title: Secure the braid with a hair tie.
steps.content: Secure the braid with a hair tie. Use a thin hair tie that matches your hair color, or a clear one.

steps.title: Style the braid.
steps.content: Style the braid. For a simple look, let dangle down the length of your hair. You can also tuck it behind your ear and secure it with a bobby pin. Here are some other styling ideas: Make a second braid on the other side of your head. Bring both braids around to the back of your head. Secure them with bobby pins, then cover them with strands of hair. [10] X Research source Make a second braid on the other side of your head. Gather all of your hair into a low bun at the nap of your head. [11] X Research source Fluff up the braid for a fuller look. Grab the bottom of the braid with one hand, and the elastic with the other. Slide the elastic upwards, then gently tug on the outer strands on the braid. [12] X Research source
